author: Special Correspondent
text:
Adivasi women allege rape, molestation

The Congress on Monday accused the BJP government in Chhattisgarh of using “gang-rapes, fake encounters and intimidation” to suppress the “hapless” tribal population and demanded a “fair investigation” in such cases.

At a press briefing here, senior Congress leader Ajoy Kumar said the worst-hit were Bijapur and Sukma districts. “Nearly 40 Adivasi [tribal] women have alleged rapes and gang-rapes by the police between October 9 and Oct. 24, 2015, and from January 11 to 14 this year at three places,” he said. “Besides gang-rapes, at least 15 women from Peddagelur and Chinnagelur in Bijapur have alleged intimidation by the police.”

Highlighting a “fake encounter,” Mr. Kumar said the police declared that Meena Khalkho, a tribal girl from Sarguja, was killed because she was a Maoist, but a judicial probe revealed that she was not. The most unsettling aspect, he said, was that the girl was brutally gang-raped.
title: ‘Police terrorising tribal people in Chhattisgarh’
